body_html:
I'm no expert on tf.data, but according to the from_generator documentation, you can specify the shapes with the output_shapes parameter. The generator is never iterated over until a session is run, so during Graph construction time, TensorFlow has no idea what the shapes will be unless output_shapes is specified.

In your from_tensor_slices example, the shape of the input to from_tensor_slices, so TensorFlow is able to infer the shapes of the output shapes.
body_text:
I'm no expert on tf.data, but according to the from_generator documentation, you can specify the shapes with the output_shapes parameter. The generator is never iterated over until a session is run, so during Graph construction time, TensorFlow has no idea what the shapes will be unless output_shapes is specified.
In your from_tensor_slices example, the shape of the input to from_tensor_slices, so TensorFlow is able to infer the shapes of the output shapes.
body:
I'm no expert on `tf.data`, but according to the [from_generator](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/data/Dataset#from_generator) documentation, you can specify the shapes with the `output_shapes` parameter. The generator is never iterated over until a session is run, so during Graph construction time, TensorFlow has no idea what the shapes will be unless `output_shapes` is specified.

In your `from_tensor_slices` example, the shape of the input to `from_tensor_slices`, so TensorFlow is able to infer the shapes of the output shapes.
